name: Network Anomaly Investigation
description: Investigation template for unusual network traffic, potential data exfiltration, C2 beaconing, or policy violations detected by IDS/IPS or SIEM.

tasks.title: Triage — Characterise the anomaly
tasks.description: Review the SIEM alert. Determine: source/destination, protocol, volume, time window. Is this a known-bad indicator or statistical anomaly?

tasks.title: Collect — Retrieve relevant logs
tasks.description: Pull firewall, proxy, DNS, and NetFlow logs for the alert window. Capture PCAP if available and permitted.

tasks.title: Analyse — Destination reputation
tasks.description: Check destination IPs and domains against VT, AbuseIPDB, threat-intel feeds. Check WHOIS and hosting provider.

tasks.title: Analyse — Data exfiltration indicators
tasks.description: Review upload volumes, DNS query sizes, HTTPS certificate details. Look for tunnelling (DNS-over-HTTPS, ICMP tunnelling).

tasks.title: Identify — Affected hosts and accounts
tasks.description: Correlate source IP with asset inventory. Identify user account and business context. Check for recent authentication anomalies.

tasks.title: Contain — Block suspicious destination
tasks.description: If destination is confirmed malicious, block at perimeter firewall and DNS. Monitor for alternative egress paths.

tasks.title: Determine — Business justification
tasks.description: Consult asset owner to determine if traffic is business-justified (e.g. cloud sync, CDN, backup). Document outcome.

tasks.title: Close — Update detection rules
tasks.description: If false positive, tune the detection rule. If true positive, document findings and update threat-intel platform.
